resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
pitrou commented on pull request #3372: ARROW-4216: [Python] Add CUDA API docs
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3372
 
 
   Also reorganize the API docs into several documents, and add/improve docstrings.
   
   To allow building the docs without CUDA enabled, I added some conditional inclusion logic.  When CUDA isn't enabled, the API docs are still generated but the docstrings are empty.  This seems to be the only sane setting that doesn't produce Sphinx errors, one way or the other.
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/io.pxi
 ##########
 @@ -44,6 +44,15 @@ cdef extern from "Python.h":
 
 
 cdef class NativeFile:
+    """
+    The base class for all Arrow streams.
+
+    Streams are either readable or writable.  They optionally support seeking.
 
 Review comment:
   Though readability/writability aren't mutually exclusive (I guess the only implementation that supports both is MemoryMappedFile)

wesm commented on pull request #3372: ARROW-4216: [Python] Add CUDA API docs
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3372#discussion_r246884214
 
 

 ##########
 File path: docs/source/conf.py
 ##########
 @@ -387,3 +391,32 @@
 # If true, do not generate a @detailmenu in the "Top" node's menu.
 #
 # texinfo_no_detailmenu = False
+
+
+# -- Customization --------------------------------------------------------
+
+# Conditional API doc generation
+
+# Sphinx has two features for conditional inclusion:
+# - The "only" directive
+#   https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/restructuredtext/directives.html#including-content-based-on-tags
+# - The "ifconfig" extension
+#   https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/extensions/ifconfig.html
+#
+# Both have issues, but "ifconfig" seems to work in this setting.
+
+try:
+    import pyarrow.cuda
+    cuda_enabled = True
+except ImportError:
+    cuda_enabled = False
+    # Mock pyarrow.cuda to avoid autodoc warnings.
+    # XXX I can't get autodoc_mock_imports to work, so mock manually instead
+    # (https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/2174#issuecomment-453177550)
+    from unittest import mock
+    pyarrow.cuda = sys.modules['pyarrow.cuda'] = mock.Mock()
 
 Review comment:
   Gosh! Seems like this should be easier
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on pull request #3372: ARROW-4216: [Python] Add CUDA API docs
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3372#discussion_r246885232
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/array.pxi
 ##########
 @@ -842,98 +855,147 @@ cdef wrap_array_output(PyObject* output):
 
 
 cdef class NullArray(Array):
-    pass
+    """
+    Concrete class for Arrow arrays of null data type.
+    """
 
 
 cdef class BooleanArray(Array):
-    pass
+    """
+    Concrete class for Arrow arrays of boolean data type.
+    """
 
 
 cdef class NumericArray(Array):
-    pass
+    """
+    A base class for Arrow numeric arrays.
+    """
 
 
 cdef class IntegerArray(NumericArray):
-    pass
+    """
+    A base class for Arrow integer arrays.
+    """
 
 
 cdef class FloatingPointArray(NumericArray):
-    pass
+    """
+    A base class for Arrow floating-point arrays.
+    """
 
 
 cdef class Int8Array(IntegerArray):
-    pass
+    """
+    Concrete class for Arrow arrays of int8 data type.
 
 Review comment:
   Too bad Cython doesn't have some kind of macro system.

wesm commented on issue #3372: ARROW-4216: [Python] Add CUDA API docs
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3372#issuecomment-453540835
 
 
   I don't know what happens when you try to load a shared library that depends on the CUDA runtime libraries on a machine that doesn't have a device. There is nvidia-docker which enables GPUs to be used in Docker containers. We can try and see what issues we run into...

kou commented on issue #3372: ARROW-4216: [Python] Add CUDA API docs
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3372#issuecomment-453717054
 
 
   We can build Arrow C++ with `-DARROW_CUDA=ON` without GPU device.
   .deb packages for CUDA support are built by Docker without GPU device. We just need to install `nvidia-cuda-toolkit` package to build CUDA support: https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/tasks/linux-packages/apt/debian-stretch/Dockerfile#L51
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

   Nice. The CUDA toolkit is a huge download, though, so better make it optional.
   (also, building with CUDA without a GPU device will probably fail some tests)

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Since parsing the CUDA API docstrings would require building Arrow with CUDA enabled, it would be better to make it conditional, for example using the [ifconfig|https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/extensions/ifconfig.html] Sphinx extension.
